history.content:
If you’re interested in learning more about biases in the tech world and their human impact, check out this online screening of Coded Bias! (Students can watch and attend for free by filling out the form below):

BAMPFA is offering free tickets to the Coded Bias documentary and conversation to UC Students. Fill out the following form to receive a free viewing link and access to the discussion panel of distinguished speakers. More Information on the BAMPFA website.

[Student Signup Form]

More about the film: (Available to view Nov. 18-24th) Coded Bias explores how the fallibility of artificial intelligence due to the implicit bias of its creators can have damaging real-world consequences.

More about the panel: (Live Thursday, November 19 at 6 PM PST) a live conversation and Q&A with data journalist Meredith Broussard;  principal researcher at Microsoft Research danah boyd; fellow at Argonne National Laboratory PhD candidate at the UC Berkeley School of Information Valerie E. Taylor; and PhD candidate at the UC Berkeley School of Information Seyi Olojo.
history.subject: Coded Bias: BAMPFA Documentary Showing and Panel on Nov. 19th
